summary: Adds new lore-friendly weapon and armor enchantments, including holy damage, disarming, night vision, water-walking, and more.
descriptionHtml:
[center][size=6][i]~Lost Enchantments~[/i][/size][/center]
[center] [/center]
[center] [/center]
[size=5][b]Introduction:[/b][/size]
Lost Enchantments adds several new weapon and armor enchantments. Each enchantment is balanced and lore-friendly, providing the optimum play experience.

[u]Weapon Enchantments[/u]
[LIST]
[*]Disease Damage > Damages the target for x points of disease damage. Diseased targets take lingering damage.[/*]
[*]Holy damage > Burns undead for x points of holy damage.[/*]
[*]Disarm > x% chance to disarm the target[/*]
[/LIST]
[u]Armor Enchantments[/u]
[LIST]
[*]Night Vision > Improved night vision[/*]
[*]Water walking > Can walk on water[/*]
[*]Luck > x% chance to land a critical hit that does double damage[/*]
[*]Fortify Agility > Increases movement speed by x%. y% chance to slow time while under attack.[/*]
[*]Reflect Damage > Reflect x% of damage from incoming attacks.[/*]
[/LIST]

(Skip to 2:38)
[youtube]T4L6r9pdBEQ[/youtube]

[size=5][b]Where are the new enchantments?[/b][/size]
Weapons and armor bearing the new enchantments will be sold by blacksmiths, wielded by enemies, and found in treasure chests. These can be disenchanted to learn their base enchantments. *Some enchantments, such as Night Vision and Disarming, are rarer than others because of their power. These will appear less often, and at later levels.


[size=5][b]I want the enchantments right now![/b][/size]
For immersion I recommend playing the game as normal and discovering the new enchantments as you go, but if you really want the base enchantments right away then follow these steps.
1. Open the console with ~
2. Type <help>, followed by the piece of weapon/armor you want:
-Iron Sword of Filth (Disease)
-Iron Sword of Light (Holy)
-Dwarven Sword of Parrying (Disarm)
-Iron Boots of Swiftness (Fortify Agility)
-Leather Boots of Waterwalking (Water-walking)
-Ring of Minor Luck (Luck)
-Dwarven Helmet of Night Vision (Night vision)
-Leather Armor of Minor Reflection (Reflect Damage)
3. Type <player.additem xxxxxx 1>, where xxxxx is the ID of the weapon/armor you want
4. Disenchant the weapon/armor and enjoy


[size=5][b]Requirements[/b][/size]
-Skyrim
-Dawnguard
-Dragonborn
*YOUR GAME WILL CRASH IF YOU DO NOT HAVE DAWNGUARD AND DRAGONBORN INSTALLED.

***LostEnchantments.esp has already been cleaned by TES5edit. You do not need to clean the file.*******


[size=5][b]Installation[/b][/size]
[u]NMM:[/u]
1) Download via the green NMM button
2) Install with NMM
3) If you have another mod that adds weapons or armor: Merge your leveled lists with Wrye Bash.

[u]Manual:[/u]
1) Download via the 'manual download' link
2) Put everything in the zip file into your skyrim/data folder
3) If you have another mod that adds weapons or armor: Merge your leveled lists with Wrye Bash.
